column4: I'd like to install extendedprefs for GAIM, but I'm unable to, as it uses libtool, and I don't have anything else installed with it, so all of the environment variables and such are undeclared.  What should I do?
Why not install libtool?
I did, but I'm getting things like "extendedprefs.c:553: error: `GAIM_MINOR_VERSION' undeclared here (not in a function)"
(tons and tons of things like that)
Add the word multiverse to the end of the line that has universe on it.
The deb lines that is.
Why didn't you make it the debian way? A lot easier.
No
Hope you still have your old kernel set up./
How did it go?
Any advice? =)
Yes, this is true.
Let me be the millionth to point out:  End-users can use JACK happily;  Any kind of serious audio workstation can't be without it.

I know. The thing is that it forces all apps to work at particular sample rates, which then means that if they need to resample, there is more work to do. Then there is also the problem of badly coded jack clients.
I am on the jackit-devel list and this sort of thing has been raised before.
The jack developers are mainly interested in it for pro audio work.
Yes.
There are many other multimedia based distros out there already. Agnulla, etc.
And they're good for nothing else.
So you mean a distro that can be used for multimedia as well as general use?
Yes.
Fair enough.
I personally wouldn't use something like that, as I like to have something optimally configured for a single use. In this case, audio work, and for this I have Slackware with my own packages.
Understood, but I am not of that type. =)
